Article Title: “Gave us time to make peace”: Dwayne Wade's wife Gabrielle Union shares how his decision helped the family during his cancer battle
Article Text:
Image via Jon Kopaloff/Getty Images

Dwayne Wade’s wife, Gabrielle Union, reveals the NBA legend’s decision helped the family to “make peace”



Gabrielle Union Gives Dwyane Wade Health Update

Dwayne Wade, the NBA legend, has been in the news lately as he recently opened up about his cancer diagnosis. Back in January, Dwayne Wade had opened up about getting diagnosed with cancer in December 2023 on his podcast, “The Why With Dwyane Wade”. He revealed that he was diagnosed with cancer when he was on a normal routine check up. Recently, Dwayne Wade’s wife, Gabrielle Union also opened up about how their family felt as Dwayne Wade had to undergo surgery.In February, Dwayne Wade’s wife, famous Hollywood actress, Gabrielle Union spoke about his health on Access Hollywood. Gabrielle Union was at the New York City premiere of her recently released movie Riff Raff when she was asked about an update on Dwayne Wade’s health.Gabrielle Union said, “He’s cancer free now. He was smart to delay talking about it diagnosis and his surgery for over a year to give us a little time to make peace with it and let all of our very intense fears dissipate a little bit, but he’s doing well.”Gabrielle Union also spoke about how brave her husband has been through his cancer journey. She said, “He was brave enough to not only go through all the things he needed to do to take care of his health, but to share it with the world and save other people.”Dwayne Wade’s cancer revelation had sent shockwaves among his fans. Recently, the NBA legend appeared on Today with Jenna & Friends where he opened up about how he was trying to deal with it emotionally.Dwayne Wade spoke about how there has been an “image” of him being really strong and confident due to his successful NBA career. He added, "No one has ever really experienced me being weak…but this was a moment where I knew I was going to be uncertain and a little weak."However, everything worked out in Dwayne Wade’s favour as he is cancer free now. Dwayne Wade has revealed that a cyst was found on one of his kidneys and he had to get it surgically removed.Currently, the NBA legend has one kidney and the other kidney is at 60 percent since 40 percent of it had to be surgically removed. But Dwayne Wade is completely fine and is doing pretty well and is now busy spreading awareness among his fans about his diagnosis and treatment.Also Read: “Everyone just gives him space”: Bronny James’ impressive performance in Lakers vs Bucks raises eyebrows
Article Summary: Dwayne wade’s wife, gabrielle union, gave an update on her husband's health. The nba legend was diagnosed with cancer in december 2023. Dwayne wade has revealed that a cyst was found on one of his kidneys and he had to get it surgically removed.

Article Title: “The toll that it takes on your marriage”: Dwayne Wade's wife Gabrielle Union reflects on the emotional impact of the NBA star's cancer diagnosis on their relationship
Article Text:
Image via Rich Fury/Getty Images

Dwayne Wade’s wife, Gabrielle Union, reveals that the NBA legend’s health concerns took a “toll on the marriage”



Gabrielle Union speaks on challenges with husband Dwyane Wade's cancer journey #shorts

Dwayne Wade, the NBA legend, had a tough time in the last few months as he had to undergo surgery to remove cancer cells from his body. While Dwayne Wade has now completely recovered, he recently opened up about the diagnosis, his surgeries and the emotional toll it had on him and his family. Last month, Dwayne Wade’s wife, Gabrielle Union opened up about how it affected their marriage on Today with Jenna & Friends.Dwayne Wade’s wife, popular actress Gabrielle Union spoke about how the ninth year of their marriage was “very hard”. She said, “It was year nine of our marriage and ... year nine was very hard…When you mention year nine being hard, he hadn’t revealed his cancer diagnosis and his own cancer journey, so now we can put it in more context”.Gabrielle Union added, “But you also don’t understand the journey and the toll that it takes on your marriage, on your family, on your kids.”Dwayne Wade had also opened up on Today with Jenna & Friends where the NBA legend spoke about how he was “afraid” of being “weak” in front of his wife and children as his image was always of being “strong” and a “world champion”.Dwayne Wade had also revealed that his cancer diagnosis was reported when he had visited the doctor for a regular checkup. He had also spoken to a few doctors but nobody was sure of his cancer diagnosis until a third doctor suggested the NBA legend should undergo kidney surgery to check if he has any cancer cells in his body.As recommended by the doctor, the NBA legend underwent kidney surgery and a major portion of one of his kidneys was removed. When this was tested by the doctors, Dwayne Wade was informed that it tested positive for Stage 1 Cancer.However, Dwayne Wade has now fully recovered and is living his best life with his wife and their children. The NBA legend is now spreading awareness among his fans as he opens up about his own experience of dealing with cancer.Also Read: "A pain that I had never felt before": Dwayne Wade reveals he was "scared" of showing weakness to Gabrielle Union during cancer battle
Article Summary: Dwayne wade's wife, gabrielle union, reveals that the nba legend’s health concerns took a “toll on the marriage” the nba legend had a tough time in the last few months as he had to undergo surgery to remove cancer cells from his body. While dwayne wade has now completely recovered, he recently opened up about the diagnosis.

Article Title: "They leave way too much space" Cam Ward just roasted Dallas Cowboys' defense, and the Tennessee Titans are all in
Article Text:
(Image via Getty)

Cam Ward’s shots fired at Dallas Cowboys might kickstart an NFL rivalry before draft day

"Some teams in the NFL did a lot of two-high stuff, like Dallas, called a lot of Tampa, a lot of cover-two. They leave way too much space on the sideline down the seams."

"I just think the arm strength and the confidence that I'm bringing, along with me getting my receivers better, I just think I'll be able to put the ball where I want."

Tennessee Titans locked on Cam Ward as top pick, already planning future beyond Will Levis

"General consensus seems to be that the Titans, who recently had dinner with Ward, will take him No. 1 overall."

"There's virtually no doubt the Titans are taking Cam Ward."

Cam Ward hasn’t taken an NFL snap, but he's already running the show

"I've been dreaming about this since I was a kid. Whether it's NFL, MLB or NBA, I wanted to go pro in something. That's always been my destiny."

"I got hands,"

"I'm interchangeable."

Cam Ward isn't even in the NFL yet, but he's already throwing shade like a seasoned vet. The Miami quarterback confidently tore into NFL coverages, specifically calling out the Dallas Cowboys after his pro day. With Tennessee Titans locked in on him for the No. 1 pick, Ward isn't just talking the talk—he’s flexing some serious confidence.Ward sat down with CBS Sports after his pro day, and when asked about stepping up to NFL defenses, he casually threw shade directly at Dallas:That’s not your average pre-draft banter. Ward just casually dissected one of the league’s high-profile defenses, pointing out exactly where they mess up. The Cowboys might have to rethink their coverage, or at least circle Ward’s name for revenge when the rookie finally hits the field.Ward's confidence doesn't stop there—he fully believes he'll put the ball exactly where he wants at the pro level. As he put it himself:With talk like this, Ward isn’t waiting for Week 1—he’s already playing mind games.Multiple NFL insiders are convinced the Tennessee Titans have zero doubt about drafting Cam Ward No. 1 overall. Cleveland Browns insider Mary Kay Cabot made it clear:NFL reporter Gary Myers also echoed this, citing league sources:Even ESPN Cleveland’s Tony Grossi confirms the Titans have no intention of trading away the top pick. They're completely sold on Ward’s talent, confidence, and NFL-readiness.The Titans’ love for Ward also means Tennessee is fully prepared to move on from quarterback Will Levis, their second-round pick from 2023. NFL insider Josina Anderson confirmed Tennessee wants to transition away from Levis this offseason. Ward isn't even officially drafted yet, but he's already forcing Tennessee to shuffle the deck at quarterback.Former NFL GM Mike Tannenbaum thinks this makes perfect sense, calling Ward to the Titans "an easy decision." He also has Colorado quarterback Shedeur Sanders penciled in at No. 2 or 3, likely to the Browns or New York Giants. Sanders might be next-best, but right now, Ward owns the spotlight.Ward’s pre-NFL confidence and his Cowboys jab have everyone talking. The Titans clearly believe he's their franchise quarterback. Ward himself sees this as inevitable, telling former Titans GM Ran Carthon:He’s got the swagger, the arm, and apparently, the hands too—jokingly flexing about a trick-play reception during pro day:Ward said.Seattle Seahawks safety Quandre Diggs, Ward's cousin, even expressed openly that he wants to team up with him after draft day. Clearly, Ward isn't just another rookie prospect—he's already changing team plans, rivalries, and narratives before he even steps on an NFL field.
Article Summary: Cam ward threw shade at the dallas cowboys after his pro day. The tennessee titans are locked in on ward as their no. 1 pick. Ward is already changing team plans, rivalries, and narratives before he even steps on an nfl field.

Article Title: “It’s embarrassing”: Bruins defenseman criticizes Jeremy Swayman after heated goalie fight attempt
Article Text:
Image via Imagn Images

Officials break up goalie fight as Jeremy Swayman confronts Dracy Kuemper

The Boston Bruins ’ struggles continued with a 7-1 loss to the Angeles Kings, extending their losing streak to six games. A heated moment saw Jeremy Swayman challenge Darcy Kuemper to a goalie fight , but officials intervened. Defenseman Nikita Zadorov didn’t mince words, calling the team’s performance “embarrassing.”During the second period, Bruins forward Marat Khusnutdinov got into an altercation with Kings goalie Darcy Kuemper. Kuemper responded by jabbing Khusnutdinov with his blocker before putting him in a headlock. This sparked a reaction from Bruins goalie Jeremy Swayman, who, after allowing seven goals and posting a .696 save percentage, skated to the red line to challenge Dracy Kuemper to a fight.Kuemper accepted the challenge, and Swayman took off his gloves and mask, ready to fight. However, the officials quickly intervened, preventing the two goalies from going at it.After the game, The Athletic’s Fluto Shinzawa asked Bruins defenseman Nikita Zadorov—a veteran known for his physical play—about his thoughts on Swayman stepping up. Instead of praising his goalie’s actions, Zadorov dismissed the idea, making it clear he didn’t see it the same way.“Is that what it is?” Zadorov said. “Looked like it,” Shinzawa replied. “OK,” Zadorov said. “I don’t know. No comment.” Zadorov didn't hold back his thoughts on the goaltending either. “Everything goes in,” Zadorov said. “It’s embarrassing, obviously. How many times we get beat by these teams scoring six goals, seven goals on us this year? It’s definitely unacceptable. It’s not what we’re looking for. Not much to say after this one, for sure.”Sunday’s game was another tough outing for Jeremy Swayman, marking his fourth straight start without a save percentage above .900.At the time of his challenge to Kuemper, the Bruins were down 3-2. The Kings had just taken the lead after Drew Doughty capitalized on a rebound Swayman couldn’t control. Los Angeles then extended their lead with a late second-period goal before dominating the third, scoring three more times to seal the blowout.Also Read: Jakob Chychrun injury update: Capitals fans express concern as the star player suffered a scary wrist injury Toronto hopes Laughton can turn things around as they face his former team, the Flyers, on Tuesday at Scotiabank Arena. With playoff positioning on the line, the Leafs look to bounce back from their recent struggles. Puck drop is at 7 p.m. EDT.
Article Summary: The boston bruins lost 7-1 to the los angeles kings on sunday. Bruins goalie jeremy swayman challenged kings goalie darcy kuemper to a fight. Officials quickly intervened, preventing the two goalies from going at it. Bruins defenseman nikita zadorov called the team's performance "embarrassing"

Article Title: “Those tears today were tears of JOY”: Dwight Howard shared heartfelt response as Orlando Magic honored him with Hall of Fame induction
Article Text:
Dwight Howard. Image via: NBA.com

Dwight Howard inducted into the Orlando Magic Hall of Fame



Dwight Howard ’s legacy has been written in the Orlando Magic history. On Monday, the franchise honored the dominant big man by inducting him into the Orlando Magic Hall of Fame . Howard became the 13th individual to receive this prestigious recognition.The ceremony took place ahead of the Magic’s highly anticipated game against the Los Angeles Lakers— one of Howard’s former teams. Fans packed the Amway Center in record-breaking numbers celebrating the legendary NBA star’s legacy in the franchise.Dwight Howard was overjoyed with the honor. "I am overwhelmed with gratitude and emotion, reflecting on my journey with the Orlando Magic. It brings back a flood of memories, challenges, triumphs, and more importantly, the people who stood by me throughout," he said.Howard further took to X to share his emotional response. “Those tears today were tears of JOY,” he wrote.The 39-year-old added, “Tears for that 10 year old that said he was going to be the #1 pick in the NBA draft! Tears for the 18 year old kid that was handed the keys to a franchise and a city. Tears for the ups & downs on this long journey I had in the NBA. Everything comes full circle and I want to thank the Magic again for inducting me into the Orlando Magic HOF 💙”Drafted first overall by Orlando in 2004, Howard quickly became the face of the franchise. Over his eight seasons with the Magic, he rewrote the record books, becoming the team’s all-time leader in points, rebounds, blocks, and minutes played.His dominance in the paint earned him three consecutive NBA Defensive Player of the Year awards. More importantly, he led the Magic to the NBA Finals in 2009 and the Eastern Conference Finals in 2010. He gave the franchise its most successful era since its inception."This place has been my home. It’s where I started my career. It was the most important eight years of my young life… there were a lot of things I had to grow up and learn fast," Howard said at the ceremony.Magic CEO Alex Martin also acknowledged Howard’s contributions, "Some of the greatest memories in Magic history came during that era… just to have watched Dwight, his incredible play, along with his teammates, those were great times that Magic fans will never forget."Also Read: “That’s to help his team win”: Anthony Davis earns praise from Dallas Mavericks coach Jason Kidd as he returns to the roster Magic’s tribute to Howard was also celebrated by a reported record-breaking attendance of 19,598 spectators. Regardless, the honor was another accolade to his legacy-enriched career in the NBA. Howard last played for the Los Angeles Lakers .
Article Summary: Dwight howard was inducted into the orlando magic hall of fame on monday. Howard became the 13th individual to receive this prestigious recognition. The ceremony took place ahead of the magic’s highly anticipated game against the los angeles lakers.

Article Title: Has Wayne Gretzky forgotten his Canadian roots? A national icon’s choices leave fans questioning his allegiance
Article Text:
Image via Getty Images

A missed opportunity at the 4 Nations Face-Off



Does Gretzky still consider Canada home?

Few athletes in the history of sports have been as popular in Canada as Wayne Gretzky . From his early days as a child prodigy in Brantford to being the heart and soul of the Edmonton Oilers dynasty, his path has been one of unprecedented achievement. For decades, he was not just a hockey player—he was a national symbol. But recent developments have left many Canadians asking: has Gretzky moved away from the nation that raised him?The controversy flared again when Wayne Gretzky showed up as Canada's honorary captain during the 4 Nations Face-Off Final. Rather than wearing a red-and-white jersey to symbolize the nation that turned him into a legend, he showed up in a blue suit. More importantly, he took to the ice close to the U.S. bench and gave a thumbs-up to the American players. The symbolic faux pas left many Canadians feeling snubbed. As one sports writer wrote, he was unable to "read the room."This is not the first time Wayne Gretzky's Canadian connections have been called into question. His public endorsement of former U.S. President Donald Trump , including trips to Mar-a-Lago, has also raised questions. While personal politics are a private affair, aligning with a divisive figure often has public repercussions. But, as many fans admit, political decisions don't always determine national identity.What hurts more for Canadians is the feeling that Wayne Gretzky has moved away from the nation that raised him. He departed for Los Angeles in 1988, a deal that made him cry and broke the heart of Edmonton. But even then, Canada still owned him. Now, though, instances like the 4 Nations final present a different tale—one in which Gretzky seems more suited to his life in America than his Canadian heritage.Also Read: Wayne Gretzky's daughter Emma Gretzky celebrates boyfriend Stone Eby’s 22nd birthday with heartfelt tribute All it would have required was a little gesture—a red-and-white jersey, a wink at the nation that built him The Great One. But instead, Wayne Gretzky's decision left Canadians asking themselves whether their greatest hockey idol still sees them as his own.
Article Summary: Wayne gretzky showed up as canada's honorary captain during the 4 nations face-off final. Rather than wearing a red-and-white jersey to symbolize the nation that turned him into a legend, he showed up in a blue suit. The symbolic faux pas left many canadians feeling snubbed.

Recently, she confronted Naomi on WWE SmackDown after losing to Liv Morgan due to Naomi’s distraction. Cargill’s personal life faced a setback with her mother’s death in 2023. She shares a daughter with Brandon Phillips.

Article Title: Will LaMelo Ball play tonight against the Orlando Magic? Latest update on the Charlotte Hornets star's injury report (March 25, 2025)
Article Text:
Is LaMelo Ball playing tonight? (Image via NBA)

Charlotte Hornets

LaMelo Ball

Is LaMelo Ball playing tonight? Charlotte Hornets injury report for tonight’s game against the Orlando Magic (March 25, 2025)

Hornets injury report March 25 (Image via NBA)

Orlando Magic’s injury report for tonight’s game against the Charlotte Hornets (March 25, 2025)

When and where to watch the Charlotte Hornets play tonight against the Orlando Magic (March 25, 2025)?

Theface another tough matchup against the Orlando Magic on Tuesday, March 25, with injuries continuing to plague their roster. While the Hornets have four players sidelined, including key contributors like Brandon Miller and Grant Williams, all eyes remain on’s availability as the team fights through a dismal season. LaMelo Ball will be playing tonight against the Orlando Magic. Ball, who has averaged 23.9 points, 5.4 rebounds, and 8.2 assists in the last 20 games, hasn’t been listed on the latest injury report. Tre Mann is listed as OFS for back injuries, Brandon Miller is listed as OFS for a wrist injury, Grant Williams is listed as OFS for a knee injury injury, and Josh Okogie is listed as GTD for a hamstring injury.The Hornets’ struggles are evident in their stats—ranking 28th in points per game (105.8) and 15th in points allowed (114). Miles Bridges has been their lone bright spot, leading the team with 20.9 points and 7.8 rebounds per game. But without LaMelo Ball at full strength, Charlotte’s offense often sputters.Meanwhile, the Magic enter the game with their own injury woes, including season-ending setbacks for Jalen Suggs (quadriceps) and Moritz Wagner (knee). Despite this, Orlando’s defense remains elite, allowing just 106.1 points per game (best in the NBA). Franz Wagner (24.3 PPG) and Paolo Banchero (28.2 PPG last 20 games) will test Charlotte’s thin lineup.The game tips off at 7 p.m. ET at Spectrum Center, airing on FDSSE and FDSFL. Fans can stream it via Fubo, though regional restrictions may apply.Even LaMelo Ball’s status is clear, the Hornets’ playoff hopes are dwindling and the focus shifts to development and avoiding further injuries. For now, Hornets supporters will be hopeful about tonight’s game with their star guard staying on the court—because without him, the losses will keep piling up.Also read: Will Stephen Curry play tonight against the Miami Heat? Latest update on the Golden State Warriors star's injury report (March 25, 2025) Let us know in the comments down below who you are going to support in tonight's game against the Charlotte Hornets and the Orlando Magic. We can hope that LaMelo Ball will live up to the expectations of his fans. Also don't forget to follow TOI NBA to get the latest updates about everything happening in the world of basketball.
Article Summary: Lamelo ball will be playing tonight against the orlando magic. The game tips off at 7 p.m. Et at spectrum center, airing on fdsse and fdsfl. Fans can stream it via fubo, though regional restrictions may apply.

Article Title: Rhea Ripley granted one more opportunity to compete for Women's title on WWE RAW
Article Text:
Image via WWE

Rhea Ripley has a WWE title opportunity before WrestleMania 41

Rhea Ripley has one last chance to make it to WrestleMania 41 following the events that went down on this week's edition of WWE RAW.Rhea Ripley was riding the wave of success and was set to compete in her third straight title match at WrestleMania this year. However, it was IYO Sky who dethroned her for the WWE Women's World title before that and got her slot. But Mami was not going to let the road to WrestleMania walk past her, and now she has one last chance to earn her place at The Show of Shows this year.Last week on RAW, Rhea Ripley interrupted the contract signing between IYO Sky and Bianca Belair for their title match at WrestleMania 41. She took out both competitors and signed her name on the contract, creating confusion in the process. However, RAW GM Adam Pearce came out on this week's edition of the show that took place at the OVO Hydro in Glasgow, Scotland.Pearce clarified the situation by saying that Rhea Ripley was not a part of the match despite signing the contract. This led to IYO Sky coming out to the ring first and making it clear it did not matter who she faced. Bianca Belair came out next and claimed that she earned her one-on-one match for the title by winning the Elimination Chamber match. Rhea Ripley joined last and shouted that she only cared about having her rematch.The situation began to boil up, much like every trio confrontation in the last few weeks, and Adam Pearce made his decision. Next week on RAW, IYO Sky will defend her WWE Women's World title against Rhea Ripley, with the winner facing Bianca Belair at WrestleMania 41.The announcement led to an all-out brawl between the trio as tensions continued to build up on the road to WrestleMania. Later in the night, Adam Pearce added another twist to the title match next week. Bianca Belair will serve as the Special Guest Referee for the match between IYO Sky and Rhea Ripley, making it a must-see encounter for next week's WWE RAW.Also read: WWE RAW Results & Highlights (3/24/25): John Cena lays out his plan to retire as the 'last real champion'
Article Summary: Rhea ripley was set to compete in her third straight title match at wrestlemania this year. Iyo sky dethroned her for the wwe women's world title before that and got her slot. But mami was not going to let the road to wrestlemania walk past her, and now she has one last chance.

Article Title: "I feel great": Mookie Betts shares positive health update after stomach sickness left him out of Tokyo Series
Article Text:
Mookie Betts shares positive health update after stomach sickness left him out of Tokyo Series (Image Source: Getty)

Dodgers doctor revealed reason for Mookie Betts' Tokyo Series exit

Mookie Betts has been struggling with bad health, which also led him to miss out on being a part of the Los Angeles Dodgers roster for the Tokyo Series. Even though the Dodgers won the series, fans definitely missed watching Betts show his magic on the field.On Sunday, Mookie Betts was interviewed by reporters in Los Angeles to talk about his health status. Betts hinted at a positive health status, claiming that his "body feels great" compared to how it was feeling last week. Talking about the improvements he has noticed, Betts said:"I mean, I feel great. Like, my body feels great. I've been able to work out. I've been able to do pretty much everything but eat, which is strange. So the symptoms have kind of gone away, I just have to figure out how to get my stomach to kind of calm down."Moving forward in the interview, Mookie Betts also talked about his struggles with eating and the approach he plans on taking with his play after returning to the lineup. Opening up about his comeback plans, Betts explained:"It's just hard to fathom not eating and going to play a game. So it looks like I'm just going to be light for a little bit. Maybe I play uphill a little bit at the beginning of the season. But no, I just want to play, man. I'm tired of sitting, tired of throwing up, tired of doing all this. I really just want to play."The LA Times interviewed Dodgers doctor Heal ElAttrache recently, during which he talked about the real reason behind Mookie Betts and Freddie Freeman's exit from the Tokyo Series. Sharing details into the exact reason, ElAttrache said:"Dehydration is one of the worst conditions you can have for muscle strains. You have Mookie come out here, tear an oblique or hamstring; you can lose him for six weeks. This time of the year is the worst time to take a chance. If you're wrong and too aggressive with it … they lose six or eight weeks."Before talking about his injury, Mookie Betts made headlines when he reflected back on his time with the Boston Red Sox and compared it with that of the Los Angeles Dodgers.
Article Summary: Mookie betts has been struggling with bad health, which also led him to miss out on being a part of the los angeles dodgers roster for the tokyo series. On sunday, betts was interviewed by reporters in los angeles to talk about his health status. Betts hinted at a positive health status, claiming that his "body feels great"

Article Title: Jimmy Butler calls out 'Heat Culture' hype: 'You can name it whatever you want'
Article Text:
Image Via Todd Kirkland/Getty Images

Is 'Heat Culture' really the key to winning? Jimmy Butler isn't convinced



The Athletic

Jimmy Butler has never been one to hold back, and his latest take on the Miami Heat ’s famed " Heat Culture " is no exception. After spending over five seasons with the franchise, Butler was traded to the Golden State Warriors in a major deal on February 5. Since then, he’s been thriving, helping the Warriors go on a 16-4 run and climb to the sixth seed in the Western Conference. However, in a sit-down with The Athletic ’s Anthony Slater, Butler didn’t hesitate to question just how much "Heat Culture" actually factors into Miami’s success.For years, "Heat Culture" has been Miami Heat ’s signature, built on toughness, discipline, and a relentless drive to win. The franchise pushes it hard, and the fans take pride in it. But Jimmy Butler , who helped lead the Heat to the NBA Finals in 2020 and 2023, isn’t convinced it’s the magic formula people make it out to be. To him, it’s less about a defined culture and more about having the right guys who buy into winning.“There was some foundation to it in the sense of the work and all that stuff, which is great,” Butler told. “I’m not saying it in a bad way, but I think it’s a little bit, like, overused talking about the ‘Heat Culture.’ It is a great organization. But I think a large part of that culture is you get guys that buy into a (winning mindset).”Butler sees it pretty simply—the Heat, or any team for that matter, win because of the talent they have and the players’ commitment to a common goal. Miami has built an identity around toughness and grit, but in his eyes, that’s not what makes or breaks a team. Winning comes down to having the right guys who buy in, not just a catchy mantra.“You get some guys that buy in, you get some really good players and you get the opportunity to talk about ‘Heat Culture’ a little bit more,” Butler explained. “I’m not saying it to talk down or anything, but I think whenever you have really good players you can name it whatever you want to name it.”Jimmy Butler's Golden State Warriors success shows winning is about talent, not 'Heat Culture'Butler’s departure from Miami wasn’t entirely smooth. Before his trade to the Warriors, he was indefinitely suspended by the Heat due to internal friction with the franchise. While he hasn’t spoken much about the specifics of his exit, his comments suggest he sees team success as more about player commitment than a branded culture.Since arriving in Golden State, Butler has seamlessly fit into the Warriors' system, helping the team turn their season around. The Warriors’ resurgence further supports his point—teams with elite players and the right mentality will find ways to win, regardless of the slogans attached to them.Butler’s take challenges the traditional narrative surrounding team culture in the NBA. Much like the New England Patriots’ famed “Patriot Way” in the NFL, the Heat’s culture has been celebrated as a defining characteristic. However, Butler argues that while having a guiding principle is beneficial, it’s not the secret ingredient to success.Also Read: Jimmy Butler on Draymond Green’s Defensive Masterclass Against Milwaukee Bucks: ‘You Gotta Respect the Hell Out of That’ At the end of the day, Butler believes that culture is what you make of it—and having the right players matters more than the words used to define a franchise. Now, in Golden State, he’s proving that winning isn’t about the name of the culture, but about the talent and mindset of the players who embrace it.
Article Summary: Jimmy butler was traded from the miami heat to the golden state warriors on february 5. In a sit-down with the athletic's anthony slater, butler questioned the value of 'heat culture' he believes winning comes down to having the right players who buy in, not just a slogan.

Article Title: IPL match today, GT vs PBKS: Dream 11 Team Prediction, head to head, Narendra Modi Stadium pitch report, weather in Ahmedabad
Article Text:
Punjab Kings' captain Shreyas Iyer and head coach Ricky Ponting during a training session. (PTI Photo)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

IPL: How will GT, LSG, DC, PBKS, RR fare? Greenstone Lobo predicts

Pitch report for GT vs PBKS

GT in IPL 2025: Gujarat Titans bid for second title

GT vs PBKS Dream11 Team Prediction

PBKS in IPL 2025: Punjab Kings seek first title under new leadership

Gujarat Titans predicted 11:

Punjab Kings predicted 11:

GT vs PBKS squads, IPL match Today

GT vs PBKS head-to-head record

GT vs PBKS: Ahmedabad weather prediction

The Punjab Kings will begin their IPL 2025 season against the Gujarat Titans today, with Shreyas Iyer making his debut as captain.After 18 years without a title, the franchise is counting on Iyer’s leadership to turn their fortunes around. Having led Kolkata Knight Riders to IPL title last season and Delhi Capitals to the final in 2020, Iyer is seen as the ideal choice to revitalise the team.Punjab Kings have struggled in recent seasons, failing to reach the top five in the last four editions. Their best IPL result came in 2014, when they were runners-up, and in 2018, when they reached the semifinals.Iyer’s appointment as captain represents a new strategy, further strengthened by his reunion with coach Ricky Ponting, with whom he has enjoyed success in the past.Both captains - Iyer and Shubman Gill - come into this match in great form, following their performances in India's recent Champions Trophy win in Dubai. Iyer led in run-scoring with 243 runs in five matches, while Gujarat Titans' skipper Gill impressed with a century against Bangladesh.The Gujarat Titans, who won the IPL title in 2022 and were runners-up in 2023, faced challenges last season under Gill's captaincy, finishing eighth.Aiming for a strong comeback, the Titans have built a formidable squad, featuring Gill and Jos Buttler as openers, along with a solid middle order including Sherfane Rutherford, Sai Sudharsan, and Masood Shahrukh Khan. The all-round capabilities of Rashid Khan, Rahul Tewatia, Glenn Phillips, Washington Sundar, and Mahipal Lomror enhance their depth and potential.Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad has hosted 25 IPL matches in its history with the side batting second winning 15 of them. If that stat alone were a reflection, the winning captain at the toss should choose to field first.With Gill suggesting a 240-260 run total in the pre-match press conference, expect one more run-fest this season.In the last match played at this venue, Rajasthan Royals beat the Royal Challengers Bengaluru. Batting first, RCB scored 172 and RR chased that down courtesy Yashasvi Jaiswal's rapid 45 runs. The highest total at this venue is 233, scored by Gujarat Titans.Shubman Gill (C), Jos Buttler, Sai Sudarshan, Shahrukh Khan, Glenn Philips, Washington Sundar, Rahul Tewatia, Rashid Khan, Kagiso Rabada, Mohammed Siraj.GT Impact Subs: Ishant Sharma/Mahipal LomrorShreyas Iyer, Prabhsimran Singh, Priyansh Arya, Marcus Stoinis, Glenn Maxwell , Shashank Singh, Nehal Wadhera/Suryansh Shedge, Marco Jansen, Harpreet Brar, Lockie Ferguson, Arshdeep SinghPBKS Impact Subs: Yuzvendra Chahal/Vishnu Vinod.Gujarat Giants: Shubman Gill (c), Anuj Rawat, Jos Buttler, Kumar Kushagra, Sherfane Rutherford, Sai Sudharsan, M Shahrukh Khan, Rashid Khan, Karim Janat, Mahipal Lomror, Glenn Phillips, Nishant Sindhu, Manav Suthar, Rahul Tewatia, Washington Sundar, Arshad Khan, Gerald Coetzee, Gurnoor Brar, Kulwant Khejroliya, Mohammed Siraj, Prasidh Krishna, Kagiso Rabada, Sai Kishore, Ishant Sharma, Jayant Yadav.Punjab Kings: Shreyas Iyer (c), Priyansh Arya, Pyla Avinash, Harnoor Singh, Josh Inglis, Prabhsimran Singh, Vishnu Vinod, Nehal Wadhera, Azmatullah Omarzai, Aaron Hardie, Marco Jansen, Glenn Maxwell, Musheer Khan, Shashank Singh, Marcus Stoinis, Suryansh Shedge, Arshdeep Singh, Xavier Bartlett, Yuzvendra Chahal, Praveen Dubey, Lockie Ferguson, Harpreet Brar, Kuldeep Sen, Vijaykumar Vyshak, Yash Thakur.Gujarat, who ventured into the IPL in 2022, have met Punjab only five times in IPL history. Out of these five games, Gujarat have won three whereas Punjab have come out victorious on the other two occasion.Expect lots of sweaty faces and tired bodies by the end of it with Ahmedabad already in the thick of the heat. The 40 degree Celsius weather prediction, as per Accuweather, in the day will receed by evening but only to 32-33 degrees as the match progresses. There is absolutely no chance of rain.
Article Summary: Punjab kings have struggled in recent seasons, failing to reach the top five in the last four editions. Gujarat titans won the ipl title in 2022 and were runners-up in 2023. Iyer led in run-scoring with 243 runs in five matches, while titans' skipper gill impressed with a century against bangladesh.

Article Title: Shreyas Iyer to Shashank Singh: 'Don't worry about my hundred'
Article Text:
Shreyas Iyer and Shashank Singh (BCCI/IPL Photo)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!

EXCLUSIVE | Shreyas Iyer and Yuzvendra Chahal key to Punjab Kings' hunt for maiden IPL title: Shashank Singh

'It was for all the supporters': Ishan Kishan on animated celebration after scoring hundred

NEW DELHI: Shreyas Iyer may have missed out on a well-deserved century, but his innings was met with admiration and applause from all corners. He remained unbeaten on 97 as he walked back, yet the smile on his face made it clear — his focus was on contributing to his new team, Punjab Kings , who have been chasing their maiden IPL title since the tournament began in 2008.At the end of the 19th over, Iyer stood at 97*, with Shashank Singh at the other end on 22 off 10 balls.Putting the team’s needs ahead of personal milestones, Iyer prioritised Punjab Kings' total over individual glory.Before the start of the final over, Iyer walked up to Shashank, who was striking the ball cleanly, and told him not to worry about his century but instead focus on maximising runs for the team.Shashank responded to his captain’s trust by smashing five boundaries off Mohammed Siraj ’s over, propelling Punjab Kings to an imposing 243/5 in 20 overs.After the innings, when asked about denying Iyer a century, Shashank said:"Yes, it was a good cameo. But looking at Shreyas, that motivated me even more. Let me be very honest — Shreyas, from ball one, said don’t worry about my hundred! Just watching the ball and reacting to it.""I try and make sure I get the boundaries. When you bat at that number, it's likely that you won’t always get a good hit. I know the shots I can back. I focus on my strengths rather than things I can't do," he added.
Article Summary: Shreyas iyer missed out on a well-deserved century. Iyer prioritised punjab kings' total over individual glory. Shashank singh responded to his captain’s trust by smashing five boundaries off mohammed siraj ’s over, propelling punjab kings to 243/5 in 20 overs.

Article Title: 'Everyone's favourite': RR coach Rahul Dravid on wheelchair meets KKR players - Watch
Article Text:
Rahul Dravid with the KKR players (Video grab)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

WATCH:

RR in IPL 2025: Rajasthan Royals hope for first title in 17 years

NEW DELHI: On the eve of Rajasthan Royals Indian Premier League 2025 clash against defending champions Kolkata Knight Riders at Barsapara Cricket Stadium in Guwahati, RR head coach Rahul Dravid , currently on a wheelchair due to injury, had a heartwarming interaction with KKR players, including Rinku Singh on Tuesday.Dravid, a revered figure in Indian cricket, suffered an injury during a Karnataka State Cricket Association League match while playing for Vijaya Cricket Club. Despite the setback, the legendary cricketer remains actively involved in RR’s campaign, displaying his characteristic resilience and dedication.Rajasthan Royals shared a touching moment on social media, captioning it: "Everyone's favourite."Dravid, seen in an electric wheelchair with a cast on his left leg, was all smiles as he met KKR players, reflecting the deep respect he commands across teams.Meanwhile, both KKR and RR will look for a turnaround in their IPL 2025 campaigns, having suffered losses in their previous matches. KKR were outplayed by Royal Challengers Bengaluru , while RR faced a heavy defeat against Sunrisers Hyderabad.With both sides aiming for redemption, Wednesday’s clash promises to be a high-stakes encounter.
Article Summary: Rahul dravid is currently on a wheelchair due to injury. The legendary cricketer remains actively involved in rr’s campaign. Rajasthan royals take on kolkata knight riders in guwahati on wednesday. Both sides are looking for a turnaround in their ipl 2025 campaigns.

Article Title: IPL 2025 Points Table Update: Standings after DC vs LSG today
Article Text:
IPL team captains for the 2025 season. (Pic credit: IPL/BCCI)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

IPL 2025 Points Table: Team Ranking, Standings and Run Rate

Teams Matches Won Lost Tied NR Points NRR SRH 1 1 0 0 0 2 +2.200 RCB 1 1 0 0 0 2 +2.137 CSK 1 1 0 0 0 2 +0.493 DC 1 1 0 0 0 2 +0.371 LSG 1 0 1 0 0 0 -0.371 MI 1 0 1 0 0 0 -0.493 KKR 1 0 1 0 0 0 -2.137 RR 1 0 1 0 0 0 -2.200 GT 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 PBKS 0 0 0 0 0 0 0

The 2025 Indian Premier League is off to a blazing start, with power-packed performances setting the tone early in the season. Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) currently sit atop the points table following a commanding 44-run victory over Rajasthan Royals (RR) in a record-breaking contest.Ishan Kishan's scintillating 106 not out off 47 balls helped SRH post 286/6 -- second only to their own record 287 -- and earned them a healthy Net Run Rate (NRR) of +2.200. Chennai Super Kings (CSK) joined SRH and Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) on two points after edging out Mumbai Indians (MI) by four wickets in a tightly fought game at Chepauk. Chasing 156, Rachin Ravindra’s unbeaten 65 anchored the innings, while Vignesh Puthur impressed with a three-wicket haul for MI. CSK’s win gives them an NRR of +0.493 and third spot on the table.RCB, who defeated Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) in their opener, are second with an NRR of +2.137. Their successful chase of 175 in just 16.2 overs gave their campaign a flying start.Delhi Capitals opened their campaign with a thrilling one-wicket victory over Lucknow Super Giants, and are now at fourth in the standings with two points and a positive NRR of 0.371. LSG now sit at fifth after the defeat.Mumbai Indians are at sixth with an NRR of -0.493 after their loss to CSK. Despite Deepak Chahar’s cameo (28 not out off 15), MI could only post 155/9, a total CSK chased down with five balls to spare.Kolkata Knight Riders and Rajasthan Royals sit at the bottom of the standings, both having suffered heavy defeats. KKR were outclassed by RCB, while RR were steamrolled by SRH’s batting onslaught. Their NRRs of -2.137 and -2.200 respectively reflect the scale of their opening losses.With Gujarat Titans playing Punjab Kings next, the table is set for more shake-ups in the coming days. As teams gear up for their second outings, early momentum is already proving to be a crucial factor in IPL 2025 .
Article Summary: Sunrisers hyderabad (srh) currently sit atop the points table following a commanding 44-run victory over rajasthan royals. Chennai super kings (csk) joined srh and royal challengers bengaluru (rcb) on two points after edging out mumbai indians by four wickets.

Article Title: Skip Bayless slams Draymond Green over forgotten OKC Thunder criticism: "The all-time dirtiest player in the history of the league"
Article Text:
Draymond Green. Image via: Robert Edwards-Imagn Images

Skip Bayless

Draymond Green

Skip Bayless revisits Draymond Green’s criticism of the OKC Thunder

“Seven guys in the interview,”

“There’s a certain seriousness it takes to win in this league. And there’s a certain fear you have to instill in the team in order to win. I just don’t know if they’re instilling that fear in teams with all the bromance and stuff after the game.”

Bayless declares the Thunder are proving Green wrong

Skip CALLS OUT Draymond! Will Cooper Flagg Be Better Than Larry Bird? March Madness Bracket Blunder

“I don’t know, nobody’s afraid of

Shai Gilgeous-Alexander

? That’s what Draymond says,”

“I don’t know why not. Maybe because he doesn’t talk trash, he doesn’t cheap-shot anybody the way Draymond does — the all-time dirtiest player in the history of the league.”

A potential playoff showdown could settle the debate

“Maybe if that happens, Draymond’s teammates will be telling him in private, ‘Why did you have to say that about the Thunder?’”

“Maybe, if we do see Thunder versus Warriors, deep, deep down, Draymond Green will be scared to death.”

isn’t lettingforget his past criticism of the Oklahoma City Thunder . Months after Green dismissed the Thunder as a team that "doesn’t strike fear" in opponents, Bayless fired back, insisting Green will have to eat his words.Back in October, Draymond Green questioned the Thunder’s seriousness, particularly their postgame rituals. He took issue with their group interviews, suggesting they lacked the intensity needed to intimidate opponents.Green said.Bayless, however, sees things differently. On The Skip Bayless Show, he argued that the Thunder’s success this season proves Green wrong.Bayless didn’t hold back, claiming the Thunder are having one of the greatest seasons in NBA history. He challenged Green’s take that no one fears Shai Gilgeous-Alexander , despite the Thunder star being an MVP contender.Bayless said.He also highlighted the Thunder’s defensive dominance, pointing out they lead the league in steals, deflections, and limiting opponent scoring off turnovers.Skip Bayless didn’t stop there. He hinted at a possible Warriors-Thunder playoff matchup, suggesting Green might regret his words if they meet.Also read: Luka Doncic on LeBron James’ return: “He’s back, so it’s going to be easier for everybody” – Los Angeles Lakers eye championship push Bayless said.For now, Bayless is holding onto the receipts, ready to remind Green of his comments if the Thunder continue their impressive run.
Article Summary: Skip bayless revisits draymond green's criticism of the okc thunder. Green said the thunder lacked the intensity needed to intimidate opponents. Bayless says the thunder are proving green wrong this season. He hinted at a possible warriors-thunder playoff matchup, suggesting green might regret his words.

The NBA playoff season is less than a month away, and everyone is on the edge. The top seeds from both tables - Cleveland Cavaliers from the East and the Oklahoma City Thunders from the West have a game tonight, and will be looking to maintain their winner spots against their opponents. Halfway into the week, let's look at what games are in tonight, where we can watch them, and who could be missing out from game time because of injuries.The Detroit Pistons (40-32) and the San Antonio Spurs (31-39) will face off against each other at the Little Caesars Arena, with tipoff at 7:00 PM ET. The Pistons are looking to get an easy win against a shorthanded Spurs, even if both teams have a 5-5 run in their last 10 games,Time: 7:00 PM (ET)Venue: Little Caesars Arena (Detroit, Michigan)Where to watch: This game can be viewed on the NBA League Pass .Jaden Ivey: Out (Leg); Tim Hardaway Jr.: Questionable (Ankle); Cade Cunningham: Questionable (Calf).De’Aaron Fox: Out For Season (Hand); Charles Bassey: Out (Knee); Stephon Castle: Questionable (Knee); Victor Wembanyama: Out For Season (Illness).The Charlotte Hornets (18-53) will be facing the Orlando Magic (34-38) at the Spectrum Center, with tipoff at 7:00 PM (ET). The Magic are the favorites to win, with a 5-5 run in their last 10 games, while the Hornets will be looking to make a difference with their 6-4 run.Time: 7:00 PM (ET)Venue: Spectrum Center (Charlotte, North Carolina)Where to watch: This game can be viewed on the NBA League Pass.Grant Williams: Out For Season (Acl), Brandon Miller: Out For Season (Wrist), Tre Mann: Out For Season (Back), Josh Okogie: Questionable (Hamstring).Cole Anthony: Day-To-Day (Toe), Trevelin Queen: Questionable (Ankle), Moritz Wagner: Out For Season (Knee), Jalen Suggs: Out For Season (Quadricep).The New York Knicks (44-26) are getting ready to face off against the Dallas Mavericks (35-37) at the Madison Square Garden, with tipoff at 7:30 PM ET. The Knicks are the favorites to win, having a 4-6 run in their last 10 games, compared to the Mavs’ 3-7.Time: 7:30 PM ETVenue: Madison Square Garden (New York City, New York)Where to watch: This game can be viewed on the NBA League Pass.Ariel Hukporti: Out (Knee), Jalen Brunson: Out (Ankle), Miles McBride: Out (Groin), Mitchell Robinson: Questionable (Ankle).Daniel Gafford: Out (Knee), Dereck Lively: Out (Ankle), Olivier-Maxence Prosper: Out For Season (Wrist), Kyrie Irving: Out For Season (Knee), Dante Exum: Out (Hand), Caleb Martin: Day-To-Day (Hip); Anthony Davis: Out (Left adductor)The Miami Heat (30-41) will be facing the Golden State Warriors (40-31) at home in the Kaseya Center, with tipoff at 7:30 PM ET. The GSW are the favorites to win, even if they could probably be without their star player - Stephen Curry - with a 8-2 run in their last 10 games, compared to their opponents’ 1-9.Time: 7:30 PM ETVenue: Kaseya Center (Miami, Florida)Where to watch: This game can be viewed on the NBA League Pass.Bam Adebayo: Available (Left Knee Sprain), Tyler Herro: Available (Left Hip Contusion), Nikola Jovic: Out (Right Hand Broken), Duncan Robinson: Questionable (Lower Back Pain).Stephen Curry: Questionable (Left Pelvic Contusion).The Houston Rockets (46-26) will be facing the Atlanta Hawks (35-36) at the Toyota Center at 8:00 PM ET. Both teams are on a pretty good streak and would be looking to maintain that, byt the Rockets do have a little edge with their 9-1 run against the Hawks’ 7-3 run.Time: 8:00 PM ETVenue: Toyota Center (Houston, Texas)Where to watch: This game can be viewed on the NBA League Pass.Reed Sheppard: Out (Thumb).Kobe Bufkin: Out For Season (Shoulder), Clint Capela: Out (Hand), Trae Young: Probable (Achilles), Jalen Johnson : Out For Season (Shoulder), Larry Nance Jr.: Out (Knee).The Utah Jazz (16-56) will be at home to face the Memphis Grizzlies (43-28) at the Delta Center at 9:00 PM ET. The Grizzlies will be looking to dominate last seed Jazz to get a win, with a 5-5 run against the Jazz’s 1-9 record in their last 10 games.Time: 9:00 PM ETVenue: Delta Center (Salt Lake City, Utah)Where to watch: This game can be viewed on the NBA League Pass.Taylor Hendricks: Out For Season (Fibula), John Collins: Out (Ankle), Lauri Markkanen: Out (Illness).Brandon Clarke: Out For Season (Knee), Marvin Bagley: Out (Concussion Protocol), Zyon Pullin: Out (Knee), Ja Morant: Out (Hamstring), Lamar Stevens: Day-To-Day (Shoulder).The Portland Trail Blazers (32-40) will be facing the Cleveland Cavaliers (57-14) at home at the Moda Center at 10:00 PM ET. The Cavaliers are the favorites to win, sitting at the top spot with a 6-4 record, while the Trail Blazers are on a 4-6 run in their last 10 games.TweetTime: 10:00 PM ETVenue: Moda Center (Portland, Oregon)Where to watch: This game can be viewed on the NBA League Pass.Robert Williams: Out (Knee), Jerami Grant: Day-To-Day (Knee), Deandre Ayton: Out (Calf), Dalano Banton: Questionable (Illness).Jaylon Tyson: Out (Knee), Donovan Mitchell: Out (Groin).The Sacramento Kings (35-36) and the Oklahoma City Thunder (59-12) will go against each other at the Golden 1 Center on Sunday at 10:00 PM ET. The Thunder are the obvious choice to win the game, with a 9-1 record against their opponents’ 3-7 run in the last 10 games.Time: 10:00 PM ETVenue: Golden 1 Center (Sacramento, California)Where to watch: This game can be viewed on the NBA League Pass.Malik Monk: Out (Illness), Devin Carter: Out (Illness).Ajay Mitchell: Out (Toe), Jalen Williams: Questionable (Hip), Ousmane Dieng: Out (Calf), Alex Ducas: Out (Quadricep), Chet Holmgren: Questionable (Hip), Nikola Topic: Out For Season (Acl).Also Read: NBA Exceptions: Top 10 exceptional NBA salaries from the 1990s

Halfway into the week, let's look at what games are in tonight, where we can watch them, and who could be missing out from game time because of injuries.

Article Title: Who won yesterday's IPL match, DC vs LSG: Yesterday IPL match result
Article Text:
Delhi Capitals' Ashutosh Sharma celebrates after wining against Lucknow Super Giants during the Indian Premier League match at ACA–VDCA Cricket Stadium in Visakhapatnam. (AP)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

DC in IPL 2025: Delhi Capitals target maiden title under Axar Patel

Brief Scores:

Lucknow Super Giants: 209 for 8 in 20 overs

Delhi Capitals: 211 for 9 in 19.3 overs

In a thrilling IPL match at Visakhapatnam, Delhi Capitals secured a dramatic one-wicket victory over Lucknow Super Giants , thanks to impact substitute Ashutosh Sharma's outstanding unbeaten 66 off 31 balls.Ashutosh's match-winning innings included five fours and five sixes, culminating in a powerful six off Shahbaz Ahmed with three balls remaining to achieve the target of 210.Delhi Capitals faced early setbacks at 7 for 3 and later 113 for 6, but Ashutosh partnered with Vipraj Nigam, who contributed 39 off 15 balls. Their quick 55-run partnership proved crucial in the chase.Lucknow Super Giants struggled without their frontline pacers due to injuries. Their bowling woes were compounded by Ravi Bishnoi conceding 53 runs in his spell.Earlier in the match, Lucknow Super Giants posted 209 for 8, featuring impressive half-centuries from Mitchell Marsh (72) and Nicholas Pooran (75) on a batting-friendly surface.Delhi Capitals' bowling attack showed resilience in the latter stages, with Kuldeep Yadav emerging as the most effective bowler, claiming 2 wickets for 20 runs. Mitchell Starc utilized his variations well to secure 3 wickets for 42 runs.(Nicholas Pooran 75, Mitchell Marsh 72; Kuldeep Yadav 2/20, Mitchell Starc 3/42).(Ashutosh Sharma 66 not out; Shardul Thakur 2/19).
Article Summary: Delhi capitals secured a dramatic one-wicket victory over lucknow super giants. Ashutosh sharma's outstanding unbeaten 66 off 31 balls helped delhi reach the target of 210. Mitchell marsh (72) and nicholas pooran (75) posted impressive half-centuries for lucknow.

Article Title: JuJu Watkins injures knee in NCAA tournament, gets carried off the court
Article Text:
JuJu Watkins injury details



Watch the video of JuJu Watkins injury here

USC Trojans' standout guard JuJu Watkins sustained a season-ending knee injury during the first quarter of the NCAA Tournament second-round game against Mississippi State on March 24, 2025. The injury occurred as Watkins drove to the basket, resulting in a torn anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) in her right knee. According to a statement from the basketball program, Watkins "will undergo surgery and then begin rehabilitation shortly thereafter."While driving to the basket on a fast break between two defenders, Watkins was fouled, causing her right knee to buckle as she planted her leg. She collapsed to the floor, immediately grasping her knee and remaining down for over a minute before being assisted off the court without putting weight on her injured leg.Prior to her exit, Watkins had recorded three points, two assists, and one rebound. USC head coach Lindsay Gottlieb commented after the team's 96-59 victory, "This team rallied for her. Our fans had our back. I'm just really proud. ... It was a true team effort. I don't think I'll forget this night for a lot of reasons.""I'd be lying if I told you that I wasn't rattled seeing JuJu on the court and crying," Gottlieb added.The basketball community has expressed widespread support for Watkins, with players, coaches, and fans sending well-wishes for her recovery. The Trojans remain focused on their upcoming matchup against Kansas State as they aim to advance further in the tournament.Despite Watkins' early exit, the Trojans secured a 96-59 victory over Mississippi State, advancing to the Sweet 16. They are scheduled to face the Kansas State Wildcats on Saturday,Watkins has been a pivotal player for USC, averaging 24.6 points, 7.1 rebounds, and 3.5 assists per game this season. Her absence poses a significant challenge for the Trojans as they continue their tournament run.
Article Summary: Juju watkins sustained a torn anterior cruciate ligament in her right knee. Watkins will undergo surgery and then begin rehabilitation shortly thereafter. Watkins has been a pivotal player for usc this season, averaging 24.6 points, 7.1 rebounds, and 3.5 assists.
